message_1:
Suppose that you intercept an encrypted message containing only uppercase English letters. After conducting a frequency analysis, you find that the letter "E" appears most frequently, followed by the letters "A" and "T" respectively. Your analysis indicates that "E" appears at a frequency of 20%, "A" appears at 15%, and "T" appears at 10%. 

Given this information, what is the probability that the next letter in the message is an "E"?
message_2: Based on the frequency analysis, the probability that the next letter in the message is an "E" is 20%.
